Description: Worn carved and painted shabti with a black lappet-wig, a damaged red face and brown crossed hands in relief holding two red painted hoes; the body is yellow; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
